raw.title: [BIP-827] Enable Aave Boosted rETH/aWETH Gauge on Balancer v3 L2s
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/2032

## Summary

This publication proposed enabling new **rETH/aWETH** gauges for Composable Stable pool on Balancer v3 for Arbitrum, Base and Optimism.

## References/Useful Links

- [Rocket Pool Website](https://rocketpool.net/)
- [Rocket Pool Documentation](https://docs.rocketpool.net/)
- [Rocket Pool GitHub](https://github.com/rocket-pool/rocketpool)
- [Rocket Pool Twitter](https://twitter.com/rocket_pool)

## Protocol Description

Rocket Pool is a decentralized Ethereum staking protocol that allows users to stake ETH and receive rETH, a liquid staking token representing their staked ETH plus accrued rewards. The protocol is designed to be community-owned, decentralized, and trustless, aligning with Ethereum's core principles.

rETH accrues staking rewards over time, reflecting the performance of the underlying validators operated by a decentralized network of node operators. Users can stake as little as 0.01 ETH, making staking accessible to a broader audience.

Rocket Pool's governance is managed by the Protocol DAO (pDAO), which oversees protocol parameters and upgrades, ensuring that the protocol remains community-driven and secure.

For more details, see the [Rocket Pool Documentation](https://docs.rocketpool.net/).

## Motivation

Transitioning from Balancer v2 to Balancer v3 with an Aave Boosted pool will enhance the capital efficiency of the rETH liquidity pools. The integration of aWETH (aArbWETH; aBasWETH, aOptWETH), which earns native yield from Aave, reduces the overall incentive cost and provides liquidity providers with additional yield opportunities.

The new **rETH/aWETH** pools will serve as the primary liquidity venue for rETH on L2s, replacing the existing v2 pool. The higher amplification factor in the Composable Stable pool is expected to improve liquidity depth and trading efficiency, benefiting users interacting with Aave-based strategies.

A gauge is essential to bootstrap TVL, encourage liquidity depth, and support broader DeFi integrations for rETH.

## Specifications

### 1. Governance

Rocket Pool's governance is managed by the Protocol DAO (pDAO), comprising RPL token holders who vote on protocol upgrades and parameter changes. This decentralized governance model ensures that the protocol remains aligned with the interests of its community.

### 2. Oracles

Rocket Pool utilizes a decentralized oracle network operated by the Oracle DAO (oDAO), which consists of independent node operators. These oracles are responsible for reporting validator balances and other critical data to the protocol's smart contracts, ensuring accurate and reliable operations.

### 3. Audits

Rocket Pool's smart contracts have undergone multiple audits to ensure security and reliability. Audit reports are available in the [Rocket Pool GitHub repository](https://github.com/rocket-pool/rocketpool).

### 4. Centralization Vectors

Rocket Pool is designed to minimize centralization risks. Governance decisions are executed by the pDAO, and the oracle network is decentralized across multiple independent operators, ensuring robust security and trustlessness throughout the protocol.

### 5. Market History

The existing Balancer v2 rETH/WETH pools have demonstrated strong performance, serving as a significant liquidity venue for rETH. Transitioning to a Balancer v3 Aave Boosted pool is expected to further enhance liquidity and efficiency.

- [Balancer V2 Pool on Base](https://balancer.fi/pools/base/v2/0xc771c1a5905420daec317b154eb13e4198ba97d0000000000000000000000023)
- [Balancer V2 Pool on Arbitrum](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0xade4a71bb62bec25154cfc7e6ff49a513b491e81000000000000000000000497)
- [Balancer V2 Pool on Optimism](https://balancer.fi/pools/optimism/v2/0x4fd63966879300cafafbb35d157dc5229278ed2300020000000000000000002b)

### 6. Value

The **rETH/aWETH** pool will become the primary liquidity hub for rETH on L2s, facilitating seamless integrations with DeFi protocols that utilize aWETH. Establishing deep liquidity in this pool is critical for efficient swaps and the ease of leveraging or unwinding on lending protocols.

## Specification

Following root gauges need to be added to the gauge controller

|Chain|Pool|Pool Address|Root Gauge|
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|Arbitrum|v3 rETH/aave-WETH|0x5418a64e0cdb20548ACB394f5D00a089BAf02161|0xac3b3fff577561c58f126e4f6375f56476dd9fdb|
|Base|v3 rETH/aave-WETH|0xB7B8B3AfC010169779C5C2385ec0eB0477FE3347|0x31ccb4e5005fd37005523e6e3f1d084f9abe25b6|
|Optimism|v3 rETH/aave-WETH|0x870c0Af8A1af0B58b4b0bD31CE4fe72864ae45BE|0xd606ea6f6d93d90efafc7d21972353fb98205eb8|

### Enable Gauges

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments: 

gauge(address):`0xac3b3fff577561c58f126e4f6375f56476dd9fdb` 
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum` 

gauge(address):`0x31ccb4e5005fd37005523e6e3f1d084f9abe25b6` 
gaugeType(string): `Base` 

gauge(address):`0xd606ea6f6d93d90efafc7d21972353fb98205eb8` 
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-819] Enable Aave Boosted osETH/aWETH Gauge on Balancer v3 Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload 
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1975

[BIP-819] Enable Aave Boosted osETH/aWETH Gauge on Balancer v3 Arbitrum

# Summary

Proposal to add gauge support for the new **osETH/aWETH** Composable Stable pool on Balancer v3 for Arbitrum. 

# References/Useful Links

- [StakeWise Website](https://stakewise.io/)
- [StakeWise Documentation](https://docs.stakewise.io/)
- [StakeWise Github](https://github.com/stakewise)
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/stakewise_io) 

# Protocol Description

StakeWise is a DeFi protocol that provides a simple, non-custodial, and secure way to stake ETH and GNO, while preserving access to DeFi through liquid staking tokens such as osETH and osGNO. It enables users to not only stake but also farm, restake, and borrow against their staked assets.

StakeWise V3 introduces a permissionless staking marketplace that allows users to choose their own node operators, optimize staking profits, minimize slashing risk, and even operate their own Vaults. Vaults are isolated, trustless staking pools that offer fully customizable staking terms, ensuring a tailored and secure staking experience for individuals, DAOs, and institutions alike.

At the core of StakeWise V3 is osETH — a liquid staking token that offers in-built slashing protection and accrues rewards from a highly diversified network of validators. osETH minting is dependent on the Vault’s LTV ratio, with standard Vaults allowing minting up to 90% of the staked ETH value, and DAO-approved Vaults offering up to 99.99% LTV, backed by stringent requirements and a 5M SWISE bond for enhanced security.

StakeWise DAO, governed by SWISE token holders, oversees protocol parameters, operator standards, and Treasury management, ensuring that the protocol remains community-driven and secure.

For more details, see the [StakeWise Documentation](https://docs.stakewise.io/).

# Motivation

TokenLogic has been working with StakeWise to adopt an Aave Boosted pool upong migration liquidity from Balancer v2 to Balancer v3. The new Aave Boosted Pool will significantly enhance the capital efficiency of the osETH liquidity pool and provide liquidity providers access to yield from Aave. 

The new **osETH/aWETH** pool will replace the existing v2 pool as the primary liquidity venue for osETH. The new Aave Boosted pools will offer superior capital efficiency with WETH deposits earning yield from Aave and greater liquidity concentration, from a higher Amplification factor, is expected to enhance liquidity depth, thereby providing a better user experience whilst also generating a cost savigns for StakeWise. 

A gauge is critical to bootstrap TVL, strengthen liquidity depth, and support broader DeFi integrations for osETH, helping it become a core building block for staking-related strategies across the ecosystem.

# Specifications

## 1. Governance

The StakeWise protocol is governed by the StakeWise DAO, with all decision-making power vested in SWISE token holders. Protocol upgrades that involve upgradable contracts must undergo a community vote, followed by multisig approval, ensuring a transparent and decentralized governance process. Core infrastructure components, such as the osETH token contracts, are immutable, providing additional security and resilience to the protocol.

## 2. Oracles

StakeWise leverages a decentralized and independent oracle network consisting of 11 established staking service providers. These operators are bound by service-level agreements (SLAs) and are responsible for accurately and reliably reporting validator balances to the protocol’s smart contracts, ensuring transparency and operational integrity. [More information here](https://docs.stakewise.io/protocol-overview-in-depth/oracles).

## 3. Audits

StakeWise V3 has been audited by **Halborn**, **Sigma Prime** and Consensys. All the audits can be found [here](https://github.com/stakewise/v3-core/tree/main/audits).

## 4. Centralization Vectors

StakeWise is designed to minimize centralization risks. Governance decisions are executed fully on-chain by SWISE token holders, while the oracle network is decentralized across multiple independent and reputable staking operators, ensuring robust security and trustlessness at every layer of the protocol.

## 5. Market History

This is a new Balancer v3 pool specifically created to provide osETH liquidity paired with aWETH (Aave-wrapped WETH). The V2 pool has been doing great for the past two years and has grown to be one of the biggest Balancer pool by TVL.
cf: [Balancer V2 Pool, Eth](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0xdacf5fa19b1f720111609043ac67a9818262850c000000000000000000000635)

## 6. Value

The **osETH/aWETH** pool will serve as the primary liquidity hub for osETH, enabling seamless integrations with major DeFi protocols that use aWETH as a base asset. Establishing deep liquidity in this pool is critical to facilitating efficient swaps and expanding osETH’s utility.

# Specification

## Enable Gauges
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig '0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860' will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at '0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd' and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

- Pool address: 0x1a36195044abbad8807ceea78ec645c0c5d09593
- Gauge(address): 0x0fc6169f74b1d0bbe7a269c1ee8d92edb58b1ade
- GaugeType(string): Arbitrum

Maxi Edits:

* added pool address
* added gauge address
* add payload

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-828] Enable Smardex Boosted SDEX/waEthLidoWETH Gauge on Balancer v3 Ethereum
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/2033

## Summary

This proposal seeks to activate a gauge for the 75SDEX25WrappedAaveLidoWETH Boosted Pool on Balancer v3 Mainnet, enabling liquidity mining incentives for SDEX/waEthLidoWETH liquidity providers.

**References/Useful Links**

* [Smardex Website](https://smardex.io/)
* [Smardex Documentation](https://docs.smardex.io/)
* [Smardex GitHub](https://github.com/smardex-ecosystem)
* [Smardex Twitter](https://x.com/SmarDex)

## Protocol Description

Smardex launched “USDN” (Ultimate Synthetic Delta Neutral), a fully decentralized synthetic dollar backed by Smardex perpetual contracts on Ethereum.

SDEX serves as its governance token, allowing holders to vote on protocol upgrades and treasury allocations.

## Motivation

1. **texte en gras**Capital Efficiency: The 75/25 weighted pool optimizes capital deployment for SDEX while maintaining exposure to ETH yield via Aave's Lido ETH wrapper.
2. **Yield Stacking:** Combines Balancer swap fees, ETH staking rewards, and potential SDEX/BAL incentives.
3. **Governance Alignment:** Deepens SDEX utility by creating a primary liquidity venue for its governance token.

## Specifications

**1. Governance**

   * There is no governance for now.
   * For USDN, some contracts are renounced.
   * The remaining contracts are managed by a 3/5 multisig controlled internally by the team

**2. Audits**

   * [Paladin Blockchain Security](https://smardex.io/audits/paladin.pdf)
   * [Trails of Bits](https://smardex.io/audits/trail-of-bits.pdf)
   * [Hacken Proof](https://hackenproof.com/companies/smardex) and [Immunefi](https://immunefi.com/bug-bounty/smardex/information/) for bug bounties, up to $5,500,000

**3. Centralization Vectors**

   * There is no governance; the team manages all operations. Some contracts are renounced, while others are controlled by a 3/5 multisig

**4. Market History**

   * SDEX launched March 18, 2023, and can be traded on various DEX (Smardex, Uniswap, Raydium) and CEX (Gate, Bitget, MECX).

**5. Value**

   * Offering greater liquidity for the SDEX token
   * SDEX vote incentives (aka ‘bribes’) for veBAL holders

## Specification

**Enable Gauges:**
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig 0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 will interact with the GaugeAdder contract to activate:

* Pool Address: 0xe2332649955c7c98389480ab46dd4cb6755ac703
* Rate Provider: 0xf4b5d1c22f35a460b91edd7f33cefe619e2faaf4
* tokenized vault: 0x0fe906e030a44ef24ca8c7dc7b7c53a6c4f00ce9
* Gauge Type: Ethereum
* Gauge Address: [0x4eB7C7fD67B9b2C24d9fF1601ccDa5A01bD40c7f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x4eB7C7fD67B9b2C24d9fF1601ccDa5A01bD40c7f)

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-411] Enable GHO/USDT/USDC Gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
Payload with PR:

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/484

**Summary:**

>This pool uses the ComposableStablePoolFactory-v5 which addresses the [reentrancy vulnerability](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/reentrancy-vulnerability-scope-expanded/4345) disclosed during February 2023. This pool is to be uncapped.
>
>This proposal is for the creation of a new 3pool, GHO / USDT / USDC, on Ethereum.
>
**References/Useful links:**

>*GHO*
>* [Website](https://app.aave.com/markets/)
>* [Documentation](https://docs.aave.com/hub/)
>* [Github Page](https://github.com/aave/interface)
>* [Communities](https://governance.aave.com/)

**Protocol Description:**

>*Aave Protocol*
The Aave Protocol is a decentralized liquidity protocol that is deployed across many EVM compatible networks including but not limited to Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche and Polygon. Currently, the Aave Protocol has a TVL of approximately $6.9 Billion.
>
>* GHO is a decentralized multi-collateral stable coin that is fully backed, transparent and native to the Aave Protocol.
>* USDT is a centralised stable coin issued by Tether. 
>* USDC is a centralised stable coin issued by Circle. 

**Motivation:**

>This proposal aims to add a veBAL gauge for GHO-USDC-USDT.
>
>This pool has the potential to be added to Aave DAO's SM at a later date if the Aave DAO elects to do so.
>
> Some veBAL holders prefer to support this new 3pool instead of GHO/BPT (USDC/DAI/USDT)
>
**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** 

>* AAVE and stkAAVE serve as the governance tokens for the Aave DAO. Holders can vote on proposals at both a Snapshot level and through the Aave DAO [on-chain governance portal](https://app.aave.com/governance/). 

2. **Oracles:**

>* rateProvider0 (for GHO): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for USDT): 0x0 (none)
>* rateProvider1 (for USDC): 0x0 (none)

3. **Audits:**

>*Aave v3*
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_ABDK_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin ](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/01-11-2021_OpenZeppelin_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Trail of Bits](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/07-01-2022_TrailOfBits_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [Peckshield](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/14-01-2022_PeckShield_AaveV3.pdf)
>* [SigmaPrime](https://github.com/aave/aave-v3-core/blob/master/audits/27-01-2022_SigmaPrime_AaveV3.pdf)

>*GHO*
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/02-06-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [Sigma Prime](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/07-03-2023_SigmaPrime.pdf)
>* [ABDK](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/01-03-2023_ABDK.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v2](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/10-11-2022_Openzeppelin-v2.pdf)
>* [OpenZeppelin-v1](https://github.com/aave/gho-core/blob/main/audits/12-08-2022_Openzeppelin-v1.pdf)

4. **Centralization vectors:** 
>* Aave Governance is decentralized, and all changes must go through a transparent and well-tested governance process.
>* Tether and Circle are both centralised entities with control over which addresses can transfer there stable coin.

5. **Market History:** 
>* GHO is used in several liquidity pools
>* USDC and USDT are widely used across many liquidity pools.

6. **Value:**
>* This pool is expected to drive meaningful TVL to Balancer and Aura Finance. The assets within the pool are not yield bearing. However, the DAOs will generate revenue from receiving a portion of the swap fees.

**Pool Details**
>Link to Pool: GHO-USDT-USDC Pool - [0x8353157092ED8Be69a9DF8F95af097bbF33Cb2aF](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x8353157092ed8be69a9df8f95af097bbf33cb2af0000000000000000000005d9)
>Link to Gauges: B-GHO-USDT-USDC - [0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa) 

> **Specification**: 
>
> The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xf720e9137baa9C7612e6CA59149a5057ab320cFa`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

**Disclosure:**

>This proposal is the work of Tokenlogic who is a delegate within the Aave Ecosystem.
>Details on TokenLogics delegation platform can be found [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/tokenlogic-delegate-platform/12516).

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-624] Enable rsETH / WETH Gauge (Arbitrum)
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1032

**Summary:**

Kelp proposes to add a veBAL gauge for the rsETH/WETH pool on Arbitrum
https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x90e6cb5249f5e1572afbf8a96d8a1ca6acffd73900000000000000000000055c

**Child Gauge:** https://arbiscan.io/address/0x59907f88C360D576Aa38dba84F26578367F96b6C#code

**Root Gauge:** https://etherscan.io/address/0x061130d4715FCD4828BfCAf6B1a9B93DF5e6e4c9

**References/Useful links:**

• Website: https://kelpdao.xyz/restake/

• Documentation: [Introduction | Kelp](https://kelp.gitbook.io/kelp)

• Github Public Repo: https://github.com/Kelp-DAO/KelpDAO-contracts

• Twitter: https://twitter.com/KelpDAO

**Protocol Description:**

rsETH is one of the largest LST-based liquid restaked token on the EigenLayer ecosystem. It represents the liquidity of the underlying assets that have been deposited on Kelp. rsETH provides liquidity for the restaked positions, accumulates the rewards, and simplifies rewards management for AVSs

Kelp has more than 260,000 ETH worth of assets restaked by over 40,000 users across multiple L2s. All of this is within 4 months of launch

By providing liquidity for the restaked positions, wrsETH allows for a seamless experience to engage with DeFi activities and maximize rewards.

**Motivation:**

Kelp is seeking to establish the [rsETH/ETH on Arbitrum] and on Balancer to further enrich the liquidity of rsETH. This move aims to enhance the trading experience of users, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value for the Kelp community.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** Kelp currently operates with a multi-sig wallet. The protocol is planning to transition to decentralized governance soon
2. **Oracles:** Kelp is working with Redstone to create price feeds of rsETH.
3. **Audits:** Kelp’s smart contracts are audited by Sigma Prime and Code4rena.
4. Sigma Prime Report: https://kelpdao.xyz/audits/smartcontracts/SigmaPrime.pdf
5. Code4rena: [Code4rena | Keeping high severity bugs out of production](https://code4rena.com/reports/2023-11-kelp)
6. MixBytes: [KELPDAO LRT-ETH SECURITY AUDIT REPORT](https://kelpdao.xyz/audits/smartcontracts/mixbytes.pdf)
7. **Centralization vectors:** Centralization vectors currently are around upgradeability via proxy multi-sig and front-end hosting.

Kelp's goal is to migrate Kelp away from these vectors.

- . **Market History:** Kelp has seen meteoric growth in TVL in the last few weeks with TVL over 260k ETH and >40,000 holders of rsETH across mainnet and L2s.



Arbitrum pool: [Balancer](TO BE ADDED)
Rate provider: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x3222d3de5a9a3ab884751828903044cc4adc627e#code

- . **Value:** This will be the first wrsETH balancer pool on Arbitrum and is aimed at providing primary liquidity for wrsETH on ARB.

**Technical Specifications:**

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x061130d4715FCD4828BfCAf6B1a9B93DF5e6e4c9`

gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable Aave boosted USDN/aGHO gauge on Balancer v3 Ethereum to enhance liquidity and capital efficiency. Supported unanimously by voters and aligns with successful similar past proposals.
key_arguments_for: Enhances capital efficiency by leveraging aGHO's native yield.
Strengthens liquidity for USDN, creating a primary venue for integration with DeFi protocols.
Historical similar proposals enabling gauges have passed successfully with positive TVL impacts.
Timeline metrics show strong, stable early and late vote support for enabling the gauge.
key_arguments_against: Some forum sentiment is negative, possibly due to concerns over centralization or protocol risks.
Small number of voters may limit representation.
Potential risks around governance centralization as the team controls some operations via multisig.

evidence.quote: Proposal to add gauge support for the new USDN/aGHO Composable Stable pool on Balancer v3 for Ethereum.
Timeline metrics strongly favor option 0 'Yes, let's do it' with stable early and late vote support.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on strong timeline vote support and alignment with successful historical gauge enabling proposals.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Timeline metrics show unanimous, stable support for enabling the gauge, indicating strong voter consensus.
• Similar past proposals enabling gauges were successful and resulted in positive TVL growth, validating the approach.
• Market impact for this proposal is expected to be positive for TVL, supporting long-term liquidity health.
• Forum sentiment is mixed with some negative views, but overall does not oppose the proposal strongly, and the recommendation aligns with majority vote and timeline analytics.
• The decision to change aligns with organizational durable benefit despite limited voter count, reflecting a proactive stance on liquidity incentives.
